summary: Tesla (TSLA) ended the recent trading session at $340.48, demonstrating a -2.35% change from the preceding day's closing price . The stock's performance was behind the S&P 500's daily gain of 1.11% . Elsewhere, the Dow gained 1.19%, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq added 1.43% . Tesla's robotaxi could reshape the auto market, analysts say . Piper Sandler reiterated its bullish stance, citing Tesla's pioneering work and first-mover advantage in self-driving software . The report also warns that the broader auto market is at risk of major disruption .  Piper Sandler analysts said other US automakers are falling behind as the future of mobility evolves . They said a robotaxi crash could dent the company's lofty valuation, adding that such an event "appears inevitable"  Tesla's Q1 adjusted profits fell 40% year over year . Its vehicle delivery of 336,681 units was the worst since the second quarter of 2022 . Shares are up 40% in June, adding more than $200 billion to the market cap .  Francisco Velasquez is an associate reporter at Yahoo Finance . He says the company's price-to-earnings ratio is "insane," citing its sky-high valuation .
US equities closed mixed Wednesday as investors assessed latest comments by Federal Reserve Chair Je . Fed Chair Je said the central bank will continue to raise the interest rate .

Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) stock slides nearly 4.4% at 2.16pm today . Wall Street has trimmed its Q2 delivery estimate to around 390,000 vehicles, down sharply from 502,000 at the start of 2025 . Despite the weakening fundamentals, Tesla shares remain up 27% since April 2 .  RBC's Tom Narayan estimates Tesla's self-driving efforts account for roughly 60% of its stock valuation . Narayan believes Tesla did just enough with this rollout to be taken seriously as a contender in the autonomous ride-hailing space . GLJ Research's Gordon Johnson pointed out technical modifications to the cars may complicate Elon Musk's vision of turning parked Teslas into income-generating assets .

Tesla’s highly anticipated robotaxi launch in Austin, Texas encountered turbulence as multiple videos surfaced showing the autonomous vehicles violating traffic laws during their first day of commercial operation . Initial investor enthusiasm that sent TSLA stock up 10% before paring gains to 8% on Monday .  The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration contacted Tesla to gather additional information about the incidents . NHTSA emphasized that while it doesn't pre-approve autonomous technologies, it will “take any necessary actions to protect road safety”  Industry experts caution that Tesla’s camera-only approach, while scalable, faces technical hurdles in handling complex ‘edge cases” that could take years to resolve . The Austin deployment involved fewer than two dozen vehicles operating in a limited geography .  Analysts expect the EV giant to report revenue of $97.5 billion in 2025, compared to $97 billion in 2024 . The average target price for TSLA stock is $292, roughly 10% below its current stock price . Wall Street estimates revenue to soar to $141 billion in 2027 with adjusted earnings per share of $3.71 .  All information and data in this article is solely for informational purposes. This article was originally published onBarchart.com . In fact, the author of this article has published an article that was published by Barchart .
Consumer stocks were lower late Wednesday afternoon . Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR SPDR was down late Wednesday evening . The Consumer Staples sector is down the following day .

US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration/NHTSA is investigating incidents involving Tesla’s self-driving robotaxis . The agency confirmed on June 23 that it is aware of videos circulating on social media depicting these incidents and is gathering additional information from Tesla . Several incidents were caught on video during their first day of paid operations in Austin, Texas .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk celebrated the launch of the robotaxi operations on Sunday and congratulated employees on a successful start . Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) designs, develops, manufactures, leases, and sells electric vehicles, and energy generation & storage systems in the US, China and internationally .

First public test of robotaxis byTeslain Austin, Texas led to multiple traffic problems and driving issues . Issues included robotaxis entering the wrong lane, dropping passengers off in the middle of multiple-lane roads or at intersections, sudden braking, speeding and driving over a curb .  Tesla is conducting the test with human safety monitors in the front passenger seat . The car suddenly braked with no obstruction apparent in the video . In a third video, taken from another vehicle, a robotaxi abruptly stopped twice in the middle of the road .  Tesla is testing about 10 to 20 robotaxis, which are standard Model Ys with advanced software . Reuters was able to independently verify the locations of at least 11 videos showing issues . The incidents caught on camera did not involve accidents, and one expert said some reflected a decision to focus on safety .  Tesla's experiment is unusually public . Other companies faced similar issues with robotaxis in Austin, Texas . Waymo and GM's Cruise had their own share of traffic mishaps .  Tesla rolled out the service for a flat fee of $4.20 to a limited number of handpicked riders . The service is not available to the broader public and the robotaxis operate in a limited area .  "Dropping off people in the middle of a six-lane road or edge of a busy intersection when traffic is going in the opposite direction is pretty dangerous," she said .

Wall Street veteran Enrique Abeyta is calling attention to a new AI development from Elon Musk . The chip is already “six times more powerful than [Nvidia’s] best-selling chip” and built specifically for AI that “functions like the human brain” The first major use of this new AI chip isexpected on August 1st, when Musk plans to release the final version of self-driving software for the new Robotaxi .  Technology’s potential extends far beyond autonomous vehicles . Abeyta: “This is all part of the effort to make America the AI superpower of the world”  Relations Manager at Paradigm Press Group: "Dwarren" Warren . Warren: "Warren" is Warren's partner with Paradigm PR Group .
US benchmark equity indexes were mixed intraday as markets parsed latest remarks by Federal Reserve . US benchmarks were mixed in the early hours of Wednesday morning .

Tesla's EV sales in Europe plunged 28% year-over-year to 13,863 deliveries and knocked its market share down to 1.2% . Chinese brands like BYD are stealing the spotlight, selling 65,808 EVs and growing their share to 5.9% .  Tesla has won the European EV crown for the first time in its history . Tesla is expected to win back the crown in Europe by the end of 2018 .

Tesla (TSLA) lost as much as 5% on Wednesday after European Automobile Manufacturer Association data confirmed its sales continued to struggle in Europe last month . In May, the automaker sold 13,863 vehicles in the region – down nearly 28% on a year-over-year basis . May marked the fifth consecutive month of declining sales in Europe .  Morgan Stanley’s senior analyst Adam Jonas downplayed the ACEA data and reiterated his bullish view on Tesla stock in a research note today . Jonas currently has a $410 price target on Tesla, indicating potential upside of another 25% in the EV stock .  Wall Street analysts seem concerned about the market share that TSLA keeps losing in its core electric vehicles business . The consensus rating on Tesla stock currently sits at “Hold” only with the mean target of about $293 indicating potential downside of some 10% from current levels .
US equity indexes traded mixed, with technology and communication services helping Nasdaq Composite . Nasdaqdaq Composite helped Nasdaq composite close to 1,000 shares .

Tesla sales fell 28% last month in 30 European countries even as the overall market for electric vehicles expanded sharply . The poor showing comes after Tesla's billionaire CEO had promised a “major rebound”was coming .  China’s SAIC Motor was the big winner for the month with its European sales of EVs and other kinds of cars jumping 38%. That has allowed the company to leapfrog Tesla, which a year ago was selling more cars in the region . The sales drop for Tesla comes at a crucial time for the company as it launches a test run of its driverless 'robotaxis' service in Austin, Texas .  Some passengers have circulated videos of problems during their rides, including one showing a robotaxiheading down a lane for opposing traffic . Federal traffic safety regulators said Tuesday they were looking into the videos .

New car registrations for Tesla in the European Union dropped 41% in May compared with a year earlier . May marked the fifth straight month of declining sales in the region . Tesla's market share in EU car registrations slipped to 0.9% from 1.6% in the prior-year period .  article first appeared on GuruFocus.com . Tariffs on imported goods can have a wide ripple effect on prices, especially in the auto industry . Tesla,Jeep, andHondawill be the least affected by Trump’s auto tariffs, while Buick,Hyundai, andKiawill face the steepest price hikes .  Tesla’s vertically integrated supply chain and domestic manufacturing help shield it from tariff risks . Other vulnerable brands areHyundaiandKia, each projected to see a21–22%increase in vehicle prices .  Saudi Arabia's oil sales dropped year-over-year in April by 16% . Saudi Arabia is leader of the world's largest oil exporter group, but sales have dropped by 16 percent .

Tesla stock dips nearly 4% on Wednesday morning after its new car sales in Europe fell about 27.9% in May . Overall EV registrations rose more than 27%, highlighting shifting demand . The slump cut Tesla's marketshareto roughly 1.2% from 1.8% a year earlier .  Adoption pace in Europe could remain uneven, with regional incentives and consumer preferences influencing outcomes . Monitoring delivery figures and competitor launches will be crucial for gauging whether Tesla can regain momentum .

Chinese EV competitors continued to make strong gains in the region . Wall Street analysts are currently projecting Tesla to deliver 393,000 vehicles, representing an11% year-over-year decline . Shares of electric vehicle pioneer Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) fell 4.4% in the morning session after reports showed the company's sales in the European Union plunged for the fifth consecutive month in May . The drop in European sales adds to investor concerns about weakening global demand and increasing competition from rivals . The stock market overreacts to news, and big price drops can present good opportunities to buy high-quality stocks .  Tesla is down 13.9% since the beginning of the year, and at $326.60 per share, it is down . The market considers this news meaningful but not something that would fundamentally change its perception of the business .  Tesla shares are 31.9% below their 52-week high of $479.86 from December 2024 . Investors who bought $1,000 worth of Tesla’s shares 5 years ago would now be looking at an investment worth $4,969 .

The next disruptive bet on humanity’s fate is moving into the realm of science fiction: Humanoid robots, UFOs and quantum computing . Over the past few months, issuers including Roundhill Investments, . have issued tech-related ETFs .  KraneShares and Themes have designed products aiming to capture these out-of-this-world ideas . It's the kind of thematic-investing pitch popularized by Cathie Wood’s ARK Investment Management .  Morgan Stanley sees the humanoid sector ballooning into a $5 trillion market by 2050 . In early June, KraneShares launched KOID — a fund targeting companies behind people-like robots . Roundhill, meanwhile, is preparing a competing humanoid ETF .  KOID tracks a rules-based index . The fund’s largest holdings include Jabil Inc., Lynas Rare Earths Ltd., Amphenol Corp. and Melexis .  Quantum computing is a functioning — albeit nascent — sector, with a Defiance product, QTUM, already pulling in more than $600 million in flows this year . Critics argue that some of these investment areas are yet undeveloped and might not catch on with investors .  The $11 trillion ETF landscape remains ever-competitive in the US, now flooded with more than 4,200 products . 40, according to Bloomberg data, are having a difficult time attracting cash .  Metaverse — a pandemic-era supertrend — offers a cautionary tale . It promised an immersive virtual future and drew in some of the world’s biggest brands . Facebook even changed its name to Meta Platforms Inc. to stake its claim .  Technology themes can offer early exposure to disruptive trends, analysts say . But very few themes have that level of success and some never fully materialize, they say .

EACON Mining Technology delivers turnkey autonomous haulage solutions designed to optimise surface mining operations . Its ORCASTRA system is fully interoperable with OEM equipment and features a distributed architecture for adaptability and performance in demanding open-pit environments .

The Magnificent 7 is comprised of Alphabet (GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Meta (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Nvidia (NVDA) and Tesla (TSLA) These are some of the most recognizable names in technology but also among the most powerful drivers of the S&P 500 .  June 2015 price (accounting for stock splits):$21.70 Closing price on June 16, 2025:$216.10 10-year return:895.9% Current value of $10,000 investment:$99,590 Amazon's dominant position in online retail has made it a winning bet on Wall Street .  The Facebook, WhatsApp and Instagram parent shifted much of its focus to building the metaverse a few years ago . Microsoft's recent buzz comes from its investment in OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT . Meta has since refocused on its core social medial businesses .  Tesla has positioned itself as a tech firm even though its main business is making electric vehicles . Nvidia has seen its share price rise more than 28,000% over the past decade . Tesla has faced headwinds this yeardue to Musk's work with the Department of Government Efficiency .  Five of the Magnificent 7 stocks have split at least once since 2015, so the prices listed for June 2015 have been adjusted based on later stock splits . They are not reflective of the actual price you would have paid then .

Lithium-ion batteries have dropped in cost by75% over the past decade . Chaitanya Sharma, founder of the stealthy Nascent Materials, is working on a new way to process cathode materials . Sharma’s new process could improve energy density of the cathode by up to 12% while costing 30% less to make .  iM3NY raised $2.3 million in a seed round led by SOSV . The startup’s initial focus is on making lithium-ion-phosphate (LFP) and lithium-manganese-iron-Phosphate, (LMFP), two cathode materials that have gained favor among automakers and data center operators .  Nascent has developed a process that uses less energy while also promising to create particles that are more consistently sized and shaped . The company plans to expand to other chemistries, including nickel-manganese-cobalt .  Today, the vast majority of cathode material is made in China . “How can I not rely on China for them?” Sharma said. “That’s really what we are focused on — simplifying the supply chain so we can utilize local raw materials,” he said .

RivianRIVN delivered 8,640 vehicles in the first quarter of 2025, down from 13,588 units in the same period in the previous year . This drop was primarily attributed to higher-than-usual deliveries of Electric Delivery Vans in the fourth quarter of 2024 .  With an average selling price of $88,500 across its R1 models and commercial vans in the first quarter, Rivian’s premium product positioning inherently limits the addressable market . Rivian revised its 2025 delivery guidance downward to a range of 40,000-46,000 vehicles .  LucidLCID delivered 3,109 vehicles in the first quarter of 2025, reflecting a rise of 58.1% compared with the same period in 2024 . Rivian has outperformed the Zacks Automotive-Domestic industry year to date . The company is trading at a forward sales multiple of 2.42, down from the industry’s 2.78 . Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) gained about7% Tuesday after expanding its autonomous vehicle partnership with Waymo to a wider area in Atlanta . Riders can now hail Waymo's fully driverless vehicles directly through the Uber and Uber Eats apps . The timing comes as Tesla continues limited testing of its own robotaxi service in Austin .  Uber is in a good place to go autonomous with Waymo, but the projection on whether it becomes a good long-term investment depends on scaling difficulties, local regulations, and the rate at which consumers could develop trust in fully driverless transport will be resolved .

Market demand forTeslaEVs in Europe could be building a bottom after it suffered only a 28% drop in May, the best monthly performance it has seen since the start of the year . But its share of the overall EV market dropped to 7.2%, down more than five percentage points for the month a year earlier .  Tesla does not break down its volumes by region, but it is no secret that Europe is by far its most challenging market . Volume volumes on the continent are down 37% during the combined months ofApril and May . Europe is the second largest EV market in the world after China .  Tesla’s volumes dropped in May by 28% to register only 13,863 vehicles . That led to its market share falling to 7.2%, a 540 basis point drop in just one year . Norway, the sparsely populated oil-rich Scandinavian country, is almost single-handedly helping stave off a collapse in Tesla .  ACEA publishes its figures with a near four-week delay, its monthly reports remain the most comprehensive publicly available source of information on EV demand . Tesla’s volumes sank by 40%, indicating little progress . June will prove pivotal for judging demand .

Tesla’s total sales across the Continent fell by 28pc to 14,055 in May, according to market research firm DataForce . The shift was fuelled largely by theongoing boycott against Tesla in Europe . Skoda's popularity also surged after the launch of its electric Elroq SUV model .  Tesla posted a 13pc drop in global sales during the first three months of 2025, reflecting its worst quarter since 2022 . Investors have grown increasingly concerned over the impact of Mr Musk’s politics in recent months .  Tesla’s share price has fallen by 10pc so far this year, although it has erased some of its losses . Mr Musk stepped down from a role in the White House last month and vowed to refocus on Tesla .

Tesla has a vision to become an artificial intelligence (AI) empire . The most direct way that Tesla is deploying AI is through the introduction of autonomous vehicles . Tesla is seeking to create a fleet of self-driving cars that can be hailed by consumers .  Tesla is far from the only company exploring the intersection of robotics and AI . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently said humanoid robotics could be a "multitrillion-dollar industry" Figure AI has attracted a number of high-profile investors, including Nvidia .  The use of machine learning could help train Optimus on tasks that are currently performed by human workers along Tesla's assembly line . Over time, Optimus could become sophisticated enough to complete important aspects of the manufacturing process . Tesla could subsequently deploy fleets of Optimus bots across its various factories worldwide .  Tesla stock is up nearly 30% since the start of the robotaxi launch . Elon Musk's projection that Optimus could be worth several trillion in the future -- far greater than the core EV business . While I personally remain a Tesla optimist, I think the stock has gotten ahead of itself .  Investors should continue to monitor Tesla's progress in the AI realm but wait until these various ambitions begin moving the needle for the company before buying the stock . Nvidia:if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $373,895!* Apple: If you invested  in Apple in 2008, you'd have $38,253!* Netflix: If . you invested in Netflix in 2004, you would have $676,023!  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang thinks Tesla has a multitrillion-Dollar Artificial Intelligence (AI) Opportunity Up Its Sleeve . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon .

Rivian Automotive hasn't received a lot of press recently, but when you look under the hood, there are several major reasons to get excited . The company's sales base today isn't much higher than it was at the end of 2023 due to several factors .  This year, analysts predict annual sales growth of just 5.3% . In 2026, Rivian sales growth is expected to pick up to 40.5% . After years of development, the first of three new models are expected to be released next year .  In recent quarters, Rivian has attained positivegross margins for the first time in company history . The release of Rivian's new, more affordable models should help profit metrics like this considerably . Rivian will continue to rely on outside capital to survive .  The R2, R3, and R3X are built on a different platform than the R1S and R1T . They're just stripped-down versions of those more luxury-minded vehicles . Rivian has made hundreds of hardware and software updates to its existing lineup to lower manufacturing costs .  Rivian Automotive's new models should still grow sales significantly in 2026, with some of the potential cost savings realized before the end of 2025 . The Motley Fool's total average return is793% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to173% for the S&P 500 . That came even as sales of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) increased by 27.2% from a year earlier . That would be an increase from revenue of $6.81bn and $0.62bn for the same quarter last year . Shares in Micron are up 52% year-to-date and trading close to all-time highs .  FedEx's fourth-quarter earnings beat estimates, with revenue of $22.2bn coming in ahead of an expected $21.75bn . Babcock International (BAB.L) jumped 12.5% on Wednesday morning, on the back of the defence firm's latest results .  Babcock reported operating profit of £363.9m, up from £241.6m last year . The engineering company also recommended a final dividend of 4.5p per share . Babcock announced a £200m share buyback, planned to execute over the 2026 fiscal year .  Halfords reported underlying pre-tax profit of £38.4m for the year to 28 March . Revenue of £1.72bn was up 2.5% on a like-for-like basis . CEO Henry Birch said he was "cautiously optimistic" about the year ahead .  Halfords has become the latest retailer to issue a cautious update on the outlook for consumer spending . The negative outlook for employment and the impact of geopolitical instability continues to weigh on confidence .

With Tesla's vehicle sales sliding, shareholders are pinning their hopes on its robotaxi business . Rivian is looking to launch a cheaper SUV to appeal to a more mainstream audience . Both stocks carry a lot of risk at this point .  Tesla sales are down 16% in the U.S., 50% in Europe and 9% in China . The company is pinning its hopes on its robotaxi business .  All of the Model Ys, not CyberCabs, are operating for now with a safety monitor in the passenger seat . Footage has already surfaced of one of those robotaxis driving briefly in a lane designated for traffic going in the opposite direction .  Rivian's new, lower-priced R2 SUV is expected to start at around $45,000 . The company also received a low-cost $6.6 billion Department of Energy loan for a new manufacturing plant in January .  Both Tesla and Rivian come with risks to investors . Tesla's core business is flailing, and it's pinning a lot of hope on its nascent robotaxi business . Rivian, meanwhile, is in the early innings of its journey and still has a long road to traverse before it can achieve profitability .  Rivian Automotive is backed by two large companies: Amazon, for which it makes EV delivery vans, and Volkswagen . Between the backing of those giants and its large federal loan, Rivian should have the cash it will need to further scale up its production and become profitable . CEO David Lockwood hailed a ‘new era for defence’ as the UK committed to NATO’s 5% of GDP target .  UK adults now use their phones for an average of three hours and 21 minutes a day . Sales of battery-electric vehicles jumped by 25 percent in Europe in May compared to the same month last year . Tesla, meanwhile, sold 40.2 percent fewer cars in May . Drop in demand has been linked to its ageing fleet, competition from European and Chinese rivals .  EV sales in Europe rebounded by 26.1 percent in the first five months of the year . Battery-electric cars accounted for 15.4 percent of all cars sold in May . EU aims to end sales of new internal combustion engine cars in 2035 . Chinese electric vehicle champion BYD has slowed its production and expansion pace in recent months . The decisions are a sign that BYD's robust sales growth over the past couple of years that drove it to overtake Tesla as the world's largest EV maker could slow .  Sources say production reduction and expansion suspension were imposed after sales failed to meet targets . One of the sources said the moves were aimed at saving costs, the other said they were imposed .  BYD's recent price incentives triggered a broader selloff in Chinese auto stocks and fresh price cuts from rivals . A survey conducted by the China Automotive Dealer Association in May found that BYD dealers held an average inventory of 3.21 months .  Chinese auto dealers on Monday urged automakers to pay cashback incentives within 30 days . Deepening price competition has prompted Chinese regulators to increase their scrutiny of the auto sector . Chinese automakers are increasingly looking for overseas markets to prop up sales .
